comments.content: Lol, it doesn't matter if it is old or not. It is what the answer correlates to.
Some industrial PCs still use old old system as long it is stable and has no problem. I believe this is mentioned in CompTIA book too.

questions.question_text:
A technician would like to install an internal storage drive for a computer. Which of the following cable connectors would MOST likely be used to transfer data?
(Choose two.)

discussion.content: duplexing is printing front and back, they are asking for copies of print jobs to be fully separated.. A is correct
Is in it Duplexing should be checked

questions.question_text: After a new laser printer was installed, users began reporting issues. Duplicate copies of print jobs were not delivering fully separated copies; instead, similar pages were being stacked. Which of the following settings MOST likely needed to be checked to correct this issue?
Which of the following network servers would be MOST useful in translating a URL into an IP address?

discussion.content: DNS is what translates your familiar domain name (www.google.com) into an IP address your browser can use. DNS server is correct answer here.
If you don’t know this I don’t know what to say
I thought CompTIA wants you to go update driver first before doing anything..lol
Steps to disable the touchpad will differ by manufacturer such as disabling through the operating system, and some laptops have a function key to disable it as well.
does the function key disable the touchpad?

comments.content: on most laptops there is an fkey that allows you to toggle it on/off

questions.question_text: After restoring a laptop to factory settings, a client can no longer use the touchpad on it. A technician verifies the system state was fully restored from the most recent, fully working backup. Which of the following should the technician check for NEXT using the fewest number of steps?

choices.D: Upgrade the hard drive in the virtual host machine.
choices.A: Go into the hypervisor and increase the size of the hard drive.
choices.C: Move the VM to another virtual host with more resources.
choices.B: Spin up a new VM for Ann with a larger hard drive.

comments.content: She's got that Drive (a HARD one at that) in her box already, it's just not big enough for her needs ;-)

discussion.content: a VM cannot increase the size of its own drive. It has to be done on the Hypervisor side. Then, let's say its Windows, you would have to go into the VM and extend the partition via disk management. The answer is A.

questions.question_text:
Ann, a user, reports the 20GB hard drive on her VM is full. She frequently has to delete files so the machine is usable again. Ann would like access to a machine with a larger hard drive. Aside from the drive being too small, the machine works perfectly for Ann. A technician checks the virtual host and sees it has about
400GB of available disk space.
Which of the following should the technician do to resolve the problem quickly?
